verses.roman:
śūlaiḥ paraśvadhaiḥ khaḍgaiḥ
śataghnībhir bhuśuṇḍibhiḥ
sarvato 'vākiran śastrair
astraiś ca vibudharṣabhān

synonyms: śūlaiḥ—by spears; paraśvadhaiḥ—by axes; khaḍgaiḥ—by swords; śataghnībhiḥ—by śataghnīs; bhuśuṇḍibhiḥ—by bhuśuṇḍis; sarvataḥ—all around; avākiran—scattered; śastraiḥ—with weapons; astraiḥ—with arrows; ca—and; vibudha-ṛṣabhān—the chiefs of the demigods.
translation: Armed with lances, tridents, axes, swords and other weapons like śataghnīs and bhuśuṇḍis, the demons attacked from different directions and scattered all the chiefs of the demigod armies.
